learningContent.title: Creating a topic in a text editor

lcInstruction.p: DITA files are XML, and XML is plain text. Therefore, you can create an XML file in any text editor.
A basic DITA topic needs an XML declaration, a DOCTYPE declaration, a topic, an id attribute on the topic, and a title. That’s it.
Here is a minimal valid topic:
lcInstruction.pre: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?> <!DOCTYPE topic PUBLIC "-//OASIS//DTD DITA Topic//EN" "topic.dtd"> <topic id="myfirsttopic"> <title>Hello world</title> </topic>
lcInstruction.p: This topic is valid, but it is not particularly useful because it doesn’t have any body content. To make a topic useful, you need something more like this:
lcInstruction.pre:
Hello world

Here is a paragraph

  • bulleted lists are nice
  • especially if you have at least two items
And don't forget the notes.
